page.title: 17FIRST GATCOMBE HORSE TRIALS
page.content: It was August 7th and like most important days it was drizzling. At 10.15 a.m. the two car parks were already nearly full. The tents were full of customers, and the sun soon came out. Of course the Show Jumping was the big attraction and was soon drawing a large crowd. After lunch the Cross Country started. It is a good setting for the event because the hills make it possible to see a lot of the jumps. A favourite jump is Fence 3, which is a wall with a drop and a bank with a five-bar gate as fence 4. A lot of horses refuse here. Another popular string of jumps are 7-16, which can all be seen from one position. The Dressage is performed behind Gatcombe House, the home of Princess Anne and Capt. Mark Phillips. 1983's winner was Lucindas Green.
